Beyond its historical and architectural landmarks, Ohrid is celebrated for its serene and picturesque Lake Ohrid, a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its crystal-clear waters and diverse ecosystem. For those exploring the best places to visit in North Macedonia, Ohrid‚Äôs blend of natural beauty, historical richness, and cultural charm makes it a truly enchanting destination.

Attractions & Things to Do in Ohrid, North Macedonia

The Ohrid Old Town, with its narrow streets and traditional houses, offers a journey back in time. This historic area is filled with churches and charming buildings.

Travel Tip: Take a leisurely walk through the Old Town to explore its many hidden gems, including small shops and cafes.

3. Church of St. John at Kaneo

Perched on a cliff over Lake Ohrid, the Church of St. John at Kaneo is a symbol of the city and is known for its beautiful architecture and stunning location.

5. Ancient Theatre of Ohrid

The Ancient Theatre of Ohrid, dating back to the Hellenistic period, is still used today for performances and festivals.

Travel Tip: Check if there are any performances scheduled during your visit for an unforgettable experience of watching a show in this historic setting.

The St. Panteleimon Monastery, located on Plao≈°nik, is an important cultural and historical site, with beautiful frescoes and architecture.

7. Ohrid‚Äôs Traditional Architecture

Ohrid‚Äôs traditional architecture is showcased in buildings like the House of Robevci and the House of Urania. These houses are now museums offering insights into the region‚Äôs history and culture.

Travel Tip: Visit these houses to see traditional Macedonian wood-carving and other architectural details.

8. Bay of the Bones Museum

The Bay of the Bones Museum is an archaeological complex, recreating a pile-dwelling settlement. It offers insights into prehistoric life on Lake Ohrid.

Travel Tip: Combine your visit with a swim in the lake, as the museum is located on a beautiful stretch of shore.

9. St. Naum Monastery

The St. Naum Monastery, situated near the Albanian border, is known for its beautiful 17th-century frescoes and the springs of the Crni Drim river.

Ohrid‚Äôs vibrant nightlife ranges from traditional taverns to modern bars and clubs.

Ohrid, North Macedonia: Ratings

Sport in Ohrid: 8/10 ‚Äì Ohrid is great for sports enthusiasts, particularly those who enjoy water sports. The lake is ideal for swimming, boating, and kayaking. Culture and Attractions in Ohrid: 9/10 ‚Äì Ohrid is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its rich history and cultural heritage. Gastronomy in Ohrid: 7/10 ‚Äì Ohrid‚Äôs gastronomy features traditional Macedonian cuisine with a focus on fresh lake fish like Ohrid trout. Shopping in Ohrid: 6/10 ‚Äì Shopping in Ohrid includes local markets and small shops selling handmade crafts, jewelry, and souvenirs. The city is known for its pearls, which are a popular purchase for visitors. There are fewer options for high-end or international brands.
